Problem Overview

This Problem will use the context of profit to look at integers and the use of inequalities to describe a situation. Students will use their knowledge of equations, number line graphs, and integers in these situations.

Emerging Mathematical Ideas

Connect and deepen understanding of representing contexts with diagrams, expressions, equations and inequalities.

Informally solve equations and inequalities with one variable.

NWDYK

Describe how representations of equality and inequality are helpful in making sense of situations and in solving problems.

Launch (Getting Started)

Connecting to Prior Knowledge

Review inequalities and number line graphs with the class. They began this work in the 6th grade unit, Points of Rational. (Language)

Suggested Questions:

  • What would this number sentence mean to you x > -17? (All numbers larger than -17)
  • What would the number line graph look like for that number sentence?

Presenting the Challenge

Introduce the context of Kimâ€™s bicycle tune up business. Discuss the concepts of profit and loss.

Pass out Learning Aid 4.2: Matching Representations and Situations (or use the digital representations provided). Students will need to use this for What If Situation B. Students can cut them apart to help them with matching the situations and representations.
